user_notes: ‚Ä¢ All sensors start DISABLED for investigation
‚Ä¢ Use Key 180 investigation files to discover correct positions
‚Ä¢ Enable sensors only AFTER finding correct byte locations
1. Run integration with Investigation Mode enabled
5. Analyze JSON files for byte changes in suspected ranges
6. Update byte_position when you find correct locations
7. Enable sensor and set realistic life percentage
‚Ä¢ Look for bytes that DECREASE by 1-3 after cleaning
‚Ä¢ Focus on bytes in 1-100 range (percentage candidates)
‚Ä¢ Check suspected_positions arrays for each accessory
‚Ä¢ Cross-reference with Eufy Android app percentages
‚Ä¢ Cliff Sensors: Check bytes 90-100 range (may be status flags)
‚Ä¢ Sensors start DISABLED to avoid false readings
‚Ä¢ All life percentages start at 100% (fresh template)
‚Ä¢ Enable sensors only after verifying correct byte positions
‚Ä¢ Document your findings in the notes for each sensor
‚Ä¢ This file will NEVER be auto-overwritten
‚Ä¢ Values of 255 (0xFF) are likely status flags, not percentages
‚Ä¢ Look for logical decreases after cleaning cycles
‚Ä¢ Percentage values should be in 1-100 range
‚Ä¢ Compare multiple cleaning cycles to confirm patterns
‚Ä¢ Byte values match Eufy Android app percentages
‚Ä¢ Values decrease logically after cleaning cycles
‚Ä¢ Consistent readings across multiple test cycles
‚Ä¢ No false 255 or 0 values for wear sensors
